title: A Nasty Weed May Have Helped Ancient Humans Keep Their Teeth
teaser: Archaeologists have found that for a period of about 7,000 years, people were eating a weed that may have helped them avoid cavities. (This story originally aired on All Things Considered on July 16.)
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
